message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this amazing product that I believe will be of great value to you.  I'm starting with a price of $9,000, but I'm open to negotiating. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $6,500. Can you meet me at that price?

Bob, I appreciate your interest in the product. While $6,500 is a bit too low for me, I'm willing to come down to $7,500.  This still leaves some room for negotiation, but it's closer to what I need to make this deal work.
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $7,500, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Can you meet me at $7,000?
Bob, I understand your budget constraints.  I'm willing to come down to $7,250 as a final offer.  This is a fair compromise, and I'm hoping we can reach an agreement.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Can you meet me at $6,800?

Bob, I understand your budget is tight, but I can't go any lower than $7,000. This is a fair price for the value of the product, and I believe it's a win-win for both of us.  If you're not comfortable with this, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand your concerns about the value of the product, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Can you meet me at $6,900?
